title: Words From Mythology
description: Many everyday English words have their roots in ancient myths and legends. Can you trace these words back to their mythological origins?

questions.question: The word 'panic' comes from which Greek god?
Which everyday word for a type of fabric comes from the Greek goddess of the rainbow?
The word 'cereal' derives from which Roman goddess?
The word 'narcissism' comes from the Greek myth of Narcissus. What happened to Narcissus?
options: He flew too close to the sun
He fell in love with his own reflection
He was trapped in a labyrinth

questions.question: 'Atlas' as a word for a book of maps comes from which mythological figure?
options: A Greek Titan who held up the sky

questions.question: The word 'hypnosis' derives from which Greek god?
From which myth does the word 'labyrinth' originate?
The word 'volcano' comes from which Roman god?
The word 'tantalize' comes from the myth of Tantalus. What was his punishment?
options: He was turned into a spider
He was surrounded by food and water he could never reach
He had to push a boulder uphill forever
He was chained to a rock

questions.question: Which day of the week gets its name from the Norse god of thunder?
The word 'mercury' (the element) comes from the Roman god Mercury. What was he the god of?
The word 'odyssey' (meaning a long journey) comes from which character?
The word 'nemesis' (meaning an enemy or downfall) comes from which Greek figure?
The word 'martial' (as in martial arts) derives from which god?
The word 'echo' comes from a Greek nymph named Echo. What was her curse?
options: She could only repeat what others said
